context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Soldier steals armored vehicle, takes it on two-hour ride in Virginia: police
context_meta.summary: (Reuters) - A soldier stole an armored personnel carrier from a National Guard base in Virginia on Tuesday and took the vehicle on a two-hour drive that ended in a police chase through downtown Richmond, the state capital, state police said. The unidentified man took the vehicle at about 7:50 p.m. from Fort Pickett, a Army National Guard base in Blackstone, Virginia, state police spokeswoman Corinne Geller said in an email to Reuters.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Cops found stolen zoo animals inside this Florida man's home. But more are still missing
context_meta.summary: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday after police say they have discovered at least seven missing zoo animals inside of his Gainesville apartment Sante Fe College Police arrested Sedrick T. Price at his apartment where they recovered seven of 11 stolen animals from the college's teaching zoo within the last two weeks. He is facing a charge of grand larceny, according to 4News Gainesville. College police and the Alachua County Sheriff's Office said that three Florida box turtles, two red-foot tortoises, a skink and a squirrel monkey were found inside the apartment, the outlet reported. Six of the seven animals found were all taken sometime overnight between May 29 and May 30, officials said.

context_meta.title: UPS Has 260,000 Union Workers and They’ve Just Authorized a Strike
context_meta.summary: The strike, which would be the first at UPS since 1997, could begin after the contract expires at the end of July.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Judge who sentenced swimmer recalled amid #MeToo movement
context_meta.summary: The beginning of the end for the first California judge recalled since 1932 began almost exactly two years ago, when Santa Clara County Judge Aaron Persky sentenced a former Stanford swimmer convicted of sexual assault to six months in jail instead of a long prison term. "You took away my worth, my privacy, my energy, my time, my intimacy, my confidence, my own voice, until today," she said in a statement read in court before the June 2016 sentencing of Brock Turner. On Tuesday, Santa Clara County voters agreed and recalled the judge from office after his nearly 15-year career on the bench.

context_meta.title: San Francisco woman charged with murder after roommate found chopped up in bin
context_meta.summary: The roommate of a missing San Francisco woman was arrested and charged with murder on Tuesday after authorities found a body chopped up and stuffed inside a plastic bin last weekend while conducting a welfare check. Authorities discovered the remains Saturday afternoon believed to be that of a 61-year-old San Francisco woman whose friend reported her missing the day before, The San Francisco Chronicle reported citing sources. Lisa Gonzales, 47, reportedly cooperated with officers when they knocked on her Mission District Apartment. context_meta.title: Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty to rape charges
context_meta.summary: Movie mogul Harvey Weinstein Tuesday pleaded not guilty to two rape charges and a criminal sex act charge in a New York City courtroom. Weinstein, 66, wearing a dark blue suit, white shirt and dark tie, answered "not guilty" in a soft voice when asked how he pleaded to the indictment by a Manhattan grand jury last week. Weinstein was accompanied by defense attorney Benjamin Brafman and surrounded by court officers during the brief hearing in Manhattan Supreme Court.

context_meta.title: What The Supreme Court's Decision On The Colorado Cake-Baker Case Really Means
context_meta.summary: On Monday, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled in favor of a Colorado baker who refused to provide a cake for a gay couple's wedding, arguing that doing so would go against his religious beliefs. The case dates back to 2012, when David Mullins and Charlie Craig went to Masterpiece Cakeshop to order a cake for their wedding reception.
